description: Management and evaluation of primary care problems of children in a variety of ambulatory settings. Opportunity to implement the role of nurse practitioner with children and their families in the community occurs under the guidance of faculty and experienced preceptors. The initiation of health promotion and health maintenance activities with individuals and groups is stressed. Collaborative, interdisciplinary practice is emphasized as students assess and manage common problems in consultation with an appropriate provider of care. 20 hours a week of clinical experience with a preceptor is arranged.
name: CLINICAL PRACTICUM: PRIMARY CARE WITH YOUNG FAMILIES

section.name: CLINICAL PRACTICUM: PRIMARY CARE WITH YOUNG FAMILIES
CLINICAL PRACTICUM: PRIMARY CARE WITH YOUNG FAMILIES

values.comments:
Management and evaluation of primary care problems of children in a variety of
ambulatory settings. Opportunity to implement the role of nurse practitioner with children
and their families in the community occurs under the guidance of faculty and experienced
preceptors. The initiation of health promotion and health maintenance activities with
individuals and groups is stressed. Collaborative, interdisciplinary practice is emphasized
as students assess and manage common problems in consultation with an appropriate
provider of care. 20 hours a week of clinical experience with a preceptor is arranged.
Students found the material covered in this course good pre-professional
preparation. Students mentioned that some aspects of the course were familiar, while
other portions were very unfamiliar, and considerably more challenging.
Most students found Professor Weill somewhat distant, albeit knowledgeable on
the topics at hand. Although he tailored the course to the audience, many students still
did not feel like they developed as strong a relationship with him as they could have.
Students summarized the work for the course as challenging, yet rewarding. One
student remarked that there were “way too many assignments.” Nonetheless, students
seemed to learn quite a lot from the lectures and assignments. Most students in the
course had a thorough background in nursing.
This review was based on fewer than 7 responses.

section.name: CLINICAL PRACTICUM: PRIMARY CARE WITH YOUNG FAMILIES

values.name: CLINICAL PRACTICUM: PRIMARY CARE WITH YOUNG FAMILIES
